alert.note: Alert for Mason; Menard (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 10:11PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Menard and northwestern Mason Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1011 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Menard, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Menard, Saline, Streeter, Camp Air, Long Mountain, Grit, Katemcy, Hext, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Ranch Road 1773, Erna, Us- 377 Near The Kimble- Menard County Line, The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Highway 29 and Us- 190 Near The Menard-Mcculloch County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for west central Texas.
